comment: Oh my goodness I just started taking chemistry as a returning student after decades in a different industry and the videos and materials my online prof has posted for us left me a little confused and very frustrated how difficult it was for me to retain whatever I had learned. I was starting to feel really bad about myself but then I decided to look around online and found this. You are a godsend, this video actually makes it easy to understand, I wish everybody would just use it lol

Just for fun it's worth noting that the kWh IS is a measurement in Joules, though not written as Joules. A watt is a J/s, thus energy per time ... and obviously hrs are a measurement of time. If we cancel and convert (hrs to secs) we end up with a result in Joules. Basically 1 kWh is equal to 3.6 million Joules.
Hey! Stop being so unpatriotic!!! Love america and our measurement system or go live in Europe, metric system but kisser☹️USA, baby. We men are all 12 inches here! Not 44 centimeters!! USA 🇺🇲
Can I join your lecture in college? You explain everything so well!!
I’m going through this playlist before i take chem in a 1.5 months and you are a great teacher. You explain this subject in a simple way. Truly, teaching is your gift.

Hello! I was wondering if you only have to be aware of the america system if you're in America? I'm doing a degree in England and i sincerely hope that i do not have to deal with anything other than the metric system 😭

At 21:01 shouldn't 10^-2 cubed be 10^-8, not 10^-6?  I haven't taken math in 40 years, but when talking about density, 2 cubed is 8, so I am confused on the discrepancy.  However, I love Chad and think he's an excellent teacher to help someone just learn chemistry for fun!!
CAT Chad

I answered my own question. When multiplying powers of 10, exponents are added.
When it’s in parenthesis, you’re supposed to multiply the exponents together. So (10^-2)^3 would be 10^-6. Hope this helps! ❤
Hey there IHIB let me know if you have a question about any part of the video here :)
